snippet: Medicare has been overpaying more than $260 million a year, including bills from hospices for inpatient care that patients did not need, investigators said.
abstract: Report by Dept of Health and Human Services finds hospices often charge Medicare for higher level of care than that required by patients, and that Medicare often pays twice for prescription drugs given to terminally ill people; extra cost to Medicare is estimated at $260 million per year.
lead_paragraph: Medicare has been overpaying more than $260 million a year, including bills from hospices for inpatient care that patients did not need, investigators said.

headline.main: Medicare Is Often Overbilled by Hospices, and Pays Twice for Some Drugs
headline.print_headline: Medicare Often Overbilled by Hospices and Pays Twice for Some Drugs, Report Finds
